titles.title: To extend the Undetectable Firearms Act of 1988 for 10 years.
To extend the Undetectable Firearms Act of 1988 for 10 years.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.
Mr. Coble moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3626.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations Discharged.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Extends the Undetectable Firearms Act of 1988 for 10 years (the Act prohibits the manufacture or possession of firearms that are not detectable by the types of x-ray machines commonly used at airports).
